author: 8BrickMario
title: "Ah, Arkham! My ol' alma mater!"
review:
Being a massive fan of Harley, I needed to get this minfigure.
 

Parts

Harley's pieces are nice, but all very specific to her.

The minifigure

Saying it right now...this is a G-rated Batman: Arkham Asylum Harley. And that's great! Seeing her in a nurse outfit is a nice reference to one of her iconic designs while keeping it kid-friendly. 

Let's start with the hair. It's a great new dual-molded piece with messy bangs and large spiraling pigtails tied by opposing-colored bands, which are a bit uneven to add some realism. The style is both classic and completely new for her, and it looks great.

Adorning her hair is a tiny nurse's hat that plugs into her hair Friends-style. It's decorated with a heart and molded so it sits off-center on her head.

Continuing the mixture of classic and new, Harley's face is very similar to past incarnations, but for the LBM addition of a red diamond beauty mark. I prefer this excited expression to the exaggerated ones she has in the Lowrider. 

Her outfit is nicely printed, with a nurse's scrubs featuring a stethoscope, large pockets, and diamond buttons. A splash of pink is found with her hands and lower arms, made to look like rubber gloves. I wish the pink wasn't limited to this, as it stands out too much. Her legs are dual-molded and printed to represent heavy-duty spike-toed and laced boots.

Lastly, Harley comes with a clipboard tile, featuring a profile of the Joker and and an "H+J" heart scribbled all over it- just like the doodles she made when first meeting the Joker in Mad Love. 

Overall thoughts

Get her! She's a great addition to the huge cast of Harleys (She now has 9 minifigures, more than any other Batman villain!) and manages to call back to various points of Harley's past while adding something fresh and new.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Holy Dangerous Medical Staff Batman
review:
Set #71017 Nurse Harley Quinn: Harley in the LEGO Batman movie features a lot of quirky little outfits, this is meant to be a disguise, but it's not much of one. Still... It works.

Nurse Harley features dual-molded legs, which look great with the boots printed on the lower portion and the little added print detailing for her upper legs. Her torso is dual-sided featuring a very nice looking nurse uniform with a red belt and a stethoscope included. Her arms are printed as well with some pink detailing for the wrists, her unique hair looks wild and crazy, it also includes a peg hole for the little nurses cap. Round everything off with a nice printed clipboard showing off the Joker's file and some extra details added by Harley... well it's a great figure.

I definitely recommend this figure, I'd say she's one that would look great and multiples are a must for all the fun parts. Any other hair that has a peg hole in it can use the little nurse's cap, which includes a fun heart print on it. So you can't go wrong with Nurse Harley.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: My favourite hair piece
review:
Opening;

Nurse Harley Quinn is a good figure with nice arm and leg printing and has some cool hands .

The Minifigure-

The hair attachment is a nurse hat with a heart print , the hair is dual moulded in red and black , the head is a happy expression , the torso is a nurse's cost and the arms are printed and the hands are pink and the legs are dual moulded and feature side printing .

The accessory -

The accessory is a sand blue 2×2 printed clipboard with the jokers file . The stand is the standard black CMF stand .

In conclusion -

this is a good figure but doesn't feature any necessarily useful parts but I still recommend it to any DC fans .
